title: Population trend due to epidemic diseases

content.description:
POPULATION OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS IN THE PACIFIC, 1778â€“1878

* 1853: 97.5% of the population born in Hawaii

** 1878: 83.6% of the population born in Hawaii

Source: Alfred W. Crosby, Germs, Seeds and Animals: Studies in Ecological History, 1994
content.question: Which of the following best explains the overall population trend shown in the table?

choices.label: Large-scale migration from the Pacific Islands to the Americas for plantation labor
The spread of epidemic diseases as a result of contact with Westerners
The expansion of the Japanese empire in the Pacific

content.answer: The spread of epidemic diseases as a result of contact with Westerners

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
